newsitem.title: USA: Merrill sees FY98 EPS in $2.40-$2.95 range.
newsitem.headline: Merrill sees FY98 EPS in $2.40-$2.95 range.

text.p: Merrill Corp said Tuesday it expects earnings for fiscal 1998, ending in January, in a range of $2.40 to $2.95 a share, compared with $2.16 earned a year ago.
"We think $2.40 to $2.45 is at the low end of the range, with $2.90 to $2.95 being at the high end," Merrill President John Castro said after the annual shareholder meeting here.
The First Call mean earnings estimate for fiscal 1998 had been $2.40 a share before Merrill reported higher than expected first-quarter earnings of $0.94 a share on late Monday.
The first quarter earnings compared with $0.54 a share a year ago and the First Call mean estimate for the quarter of $0.62 a share.
At the meeting, Castro cautioned shareholders that Merrill's investments in capital equipment and human resources this year may dilute earnings.
"We are going to continue to invest in technology and people," Castro said. "We realize that this might somewhat hurt our earnings for this year, but its critical for (fiscal year) 1999 and beyond."
Merrill Corp provides typesetting, printing, document reproduction, distribution and fulfillment services.
